column4: i want to connect two computers via ssh. how do I know the ip of each computer? this is my ifconfig in this computer http://paste.ubuntu.com/44050/ . both are running ubuntu hardy
look at the inet addr: line.

and n3hima . i tried browsing this computer's contents by opening "ssh://192.168.1.2" using the other computer but it nautilus (on the other computer) said that it can't be displayed because the host cant be found. any idea why?
ermm.. 1.2 is the PC you are on.
do you have physical access to the other PC?
maybe, its a firewall issue. how do i disable it?
did you install a firewall? Ubuntu does not come default with a firewall.
nope but i saw something from https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SSHHowto
but even still, routers dont usually block internal traffic.
ughh, netgear. But even still like I said, routers do not usually block internal traffic.
is there any way possible to hook up the wireless one via cat5?
sorry. i dont even know what cat6 is. hehe
